intro: Indorouchera contestiana, commonly known as the Indian nettle. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae, characterized by its stinging hairs on the stems and leaves. The plant is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India and Indonesia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its small greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
